title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" may be cited as the short title. It pertains to wire and electronic communications. The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends definitions in title 18, United States Code, regarding communication through a clone pager. It also prohibits the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager as defined in the Act. The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends definitions in title 18, United States Code, regarding communication through a clone pager. It prohibits the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager as defined in the Act. The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. The amendment involves inserting "clone pager" alongside "trap and trace device" in various sections. In amending Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, "clone pager" is added alongside "trap and trace device" in various sections. The amendment allows for the ex parte authorization of pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers for criminal investigations. The amendment allows for ex parte authorization of pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers for criminal investigations, including identifying the subscriber of the paging device or the number of the clone pager. The amendment allows for ex parte authorization of pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers for criminal investigations, including identifying the subscriber of the paging device or the number of the clone pager. Amendments include adding "clone pager" to various subsections. The amendment allows for ex parte authorization of pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers for criminal investigations, including identifying the subscriber of the paging device or the number of the clone pager. Amendments include adding "clone pager" to various subsections in section 3124. The amendment allows for ex parte authorization of pen registers, trap and trace devices, and clone pagers for criminal investigations. A Federal court may order a provider of a paging service to furnish all necessary information, facilities, and technical assistance for the operation and use of a clone pager upon request by an attorney for the Government or an officer of a law enforcement agency. The amendment allows for ex parte authorization of clone pagers for criminal investigations, with a Federal court ordering a paging service to provide necessary assistance for their operation. The amendment allows for ex parte authorization of clone pagers for criminal investigations, with a Federal court ordering a paging service to provide necessary assistance for their operation. The amendment also includes changes to various sections, such as inserting "clone pager" in place of "trap and trace device" in certain instances. The amendment allows for ex parte authorization of clone pagers for criminal investigations, with a Federal court ordering a paging service to provide necessary assistance for their operation. The term "clone pager" is defined as a numeric display device that receives communications intended for another numeric display paging device. The Senate passed the amendment on November 7, 1997. Attest: GARY SISCO, Secretary.
